definition: brightly colored decorations (idiom)/splendid
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
old variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 花[hua1]/flower/blossom/also pr. [wei3]
dumpling
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
brocade/embroidered work/bright
crowded/framework for silkworms/gather foliage/bunch/classifier for bunched objects

sentences.english: Air gun salute profusion, blooming new smile.
sentences.chinese: 礼炮缤纷空中啸，花团锦簇新人笑。

sentences.english: This is a garden well paved with flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这是一座花团锦簇的花园。

sentences.english: Endless vicissitudes in the flowers would not have forever.
sentences.chinese: 不尽的沧桑里不会有永远的花团锦簇。

sentences.english: Japan is update to its blossoms in summer.
sentences.chinese: 日本以其春天花团锦簇的景象而闻名。

sentences.english: She sets about decorating her desk with many pink objects.
sentences.chinese: 她用粉红色的小玩意儿将办公桌装饰得花团锦簇。

sentences.english: Spring, the earth was the spring of girls dress was decorated with flowers, and colorful.
sentences.chinese: 春天，大地被春姑娘妆扮得花团锦簇，五彩缤纷。

sentences.english: There is nothing more poetic than a flowering cherry tree .
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能比花团锦簇的樱花树更富有诗意了。

sentences.english: Guayu in Qingxin, also the soul of a love of flowers.
sentences.chinese: 于清心寡欲之外，亦有一颗热爱花团锦簇的灵魂。

sentences.english: Flowers were laid in front of the Peaceful Liberation Monument.
sentences.chinese: 和平解放纪念碑前花团锦簇。

definition: fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
red flowers and green willow/all the colors of spring
thousands of purples and reds (idiom); a blaze of color/fig. a profusion of flourishing trades
contending for supreme beauty (esp. of flowers, scenery, painting etc)/vying in beauty and glamor
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
flourishing blossom/a mass of flowers/luxuriant flowers
exotic flowers and rare herbs (idiom)
Chinese flowering crab-apple (Malus spectabilis)
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
full of life/exuberant
swaying gently/moving elegantly
blossom
lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
see 生機盎然|生机盎然[sheng1 yi4 ang4 ran2]
in full bloom
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
